title.rendered: Announcing Our Third Invited Speaker: Joseph Jacks

content.rendered:
We are thrilled to announce our third invited speaker for WordCamp Asia 2024 – Joseph Jacks! Just like our previous speaker announcements, we are excited to share the impressive credentials and insights that Joseph brings to our event.

About Joseph Jacks

Joseph Jacks is the Founder and General Partner of OSS Capital, a prominent venture capital firm based in San Francisco. Joseph’s career has been a remarkable journey through the world of open-source technology, and his contributions have left an indelible mark on the industry.

Before founding OSS Capital, Joseph served as an Entrepreneur in Residence (EIR) at Quantum Corporation, where he played a pivotal role in supporting the Rook project. His efforts led to the project’s subsequent donation to the Cloud Native Computing Foundation (CNCF), marking the organization’s first foray into storage projects. Joseph’s involvement with CNCF has been extensive, spanning board membership, committee participation, and advisory roles since its inception.

Joseph is also known for founding KubeCon, an event that is now managed by the Linux Foundation’s CNCF. Additionally, he founded and built Kismatic, the first enterprise-focused commercial Kubernetes company, which was eventually acquired by Apprenda and subsequently by ATOS. Throughout his career, Joseph has worked with other notable companies, including Mesosphere (now D2IQ), Enstratius (acquired by Dell Software), TIBCO Software, and Talend, where he held various roles in sales, engineering, product, and strategy.

Furthermore, Joseph is the visionary behind Open Core Summit, a global conference focused on the Commercial Open-Source Software (COSS) ecosystem. Open Core Summit operates as a vendor-neutral community, featuring leading investment firms, cloud providers, COSS companies, analysts, Fortune 2000 enterprises, and more. The inaugural OCS in 2019 brought together nearly 1,000 attendees from 29 countries, featured 40 major sponsors, and hosted over 100 speakers. The second annual OCS in 2020, held entirely online, drew an astonishing 13,000+ attendees, featured 200+ speakers, and was supported by 50+ major sponsors. These events have played a pivotal role in democratizing knowledge about the rapid growth of the COSS category.

Session Details

Get ready for a session by Joseph Jacks titled “Open source is eating software faster than software is eating the world,” this talk will unveil the OSS Capital thesis, revealing why open source is the most pivotal trend in technology. Brace yourselves for a journey through the implications this phenomenon holds for crypto, AI, and traditional software and tech businesses, as Joseph navigates the dynamic landscape of open source innovation. Don’t miss this opportunity to gain profound insights into the tech revolution that’s changing the game.

Stay Tuned for more information

We will be delivering more information about our speaker lineup, session details, and full depth of the schedule. Keep an eye on our blog and social media channels for the latest updates on WordCamp Asia 2024. 

Get Your Tickets Now

title.rendered: Behind the Lineup: Perth Ngarmtrakulchol

content.rendered:
As we countdown to WordCamp Asia 2024, each week we‚Äôre inviting you to go behind the lineup and get to know the folks who will be taking to the stage. In today‚Äôs post, we chat with Perth Ngarmtrakulchol, an analytics Engineer at Canva and co-founder of the WordPress community in Thailand. 

Q. Firstly, welcome to the lineup! We‚Äôre so glad to have you here. Can you start by telling us a bit about yourself? Where will you be joining the event from, and what does your day-to-day look like?

Hi! My name is Perth. I’m a data analytics engineer at Canva, juggling Python and SQL to unravel data mysteries. I am currently based on sunny Sydney, Australia.

Q. We‚Äôre lucky to be welcoming a diverse range of speakers to our program in 2024. What interested you to apply to WordCamp Asia as a speaker?

I wanted to give back to the WordPress community that has given me so much. WordPress has provided me with a lot of opportunities in the past. I made a lot of friends from organising WordPress meetups in Bangkok for several years, WordCamp Bangkok events, and WordCamp Asia 2023 in Thailand.

Q. What can audiences expect to learn from your talk/s? Are there any advance sneak peeks or knowledge bombs you can offer us?

My talk will unveil how WordPress development skills can create multiple income streams. Trust me, WordPress is cooler than you think! I’ll share real-life experiences and tips on leveraging WordPress for main and side hustles, based on true story in my past 10+ years I used WordPress.

And here’s a fun fact: these skills once scored me a free trip to Las Vegas!

This talk will be a good entertainment for developers or anyone who might want to become WordPress developer.

Q. What are you most looking forward to at WordCamp Asia 2024? Is there someone you‚Äôre looking forward to rubbing shoulder with, or a local delicacy you‚Äôd like to sample? 

I’m excited to reconnect with old pals and make new ones in the WordPress community! And I can’t wait to soak up knowledge from other speakers. Another goal for me to do in Taiwan is snapping a photo with the towering Taipei 101!

Q. Tell us something about yourself that we might not know. Party tricks? Secret hobbies?

Even though my name is Perth, I hadn’t been to the city of Perth until 2023.

Q. Lightning Round!¬†

Most-visited website: ChatGPT

Must-have gadget: Inkpalm e-reader.

Most-read book: Die with Zero by Bill Perkins

Go-to podcast: Noah Kagan Presents

Find out more about Perth’s appearance at WordCamp Asia 2024 here.

title.rendered: Behind the Lineup: Milana Cap

content.rendered:
As we countdown to WordCamp Asia 2024, each week we‚Äôre inviting you to go behind the lineup and get to know the folks who will be taking to the stage. In today‚Äôs post, we chat with Milana Cap of XWP and Toptal, about democratizing terminal, ice-skating, and their favorite podcast.

Q. Firstly, welcome to the lineup! We‚Äôre so glad to have you here. Can you start by telling us a bit about yourself? Where will you be joining the event from, and what does your day-to-day look like?

I’m coming from the most beautiful city in the world, Novi Sad, Serbia. It will be a ~20 hour trip. My days are never the same because I get bored easily, but every day consists some kind of training (ice skating, running, functional training, walking), coding, writing documentation, singing in a choir (and sometimes conducting it), reading books and great food.

Q. We‚Äôre lucky to be welcoming a diverse range of speakers to our program in 2024. What interested you to apply to WordCamp Asia as a speaker?

The more I talk about WP-CLI the more I hear from people what are their pain points in using it, which helps me shape my next talk. My motivation is to show people that everyone can use WP-CLI (democratizing terminal) and improve their everyday work with it. Also, I like to travel.

Q. What can audiences expect to learn from your talk/s? Are there any advance sneak peeks or knowledge bombs you can offer us?

I never know. My talks are live coding and demoing various things. It’s always different and can depend on audience questions during or before the talk. But I always have at least one candy that is my personal highlight of the talk. People usually pick something else as their highlight!

Q. What are you most looking forward to at WordCamp Asia 2024? Is there someone you‚Äôre looking forward to rubbing shoulder with, or a local delicacy you‚Äôd like to sample? 

A lot of people I know from WordPress Slack, but don’t have a chance to see very often (or at all). I’m looking forward to see my fellows documentarians and everyone, really.

Q. Tell us something about yourself that we might not know. Party tricks? Secret hobbies?

Coding was my hobby while I was classical musician. Now music is my hobby. I sing in a choir and, when needed, jump in as a conductor. I love ice skating and do it as much as possible during limited months in the season. I also enjoy in taking care of my plants and reading books.

Q. Lightning Round!¬†

Most-visited website: WordPress.org Developer Resources

Must-have gadget: A cookie

Most-read book: The Count of Monte Cristo by Alexandre Dumas

Go-to podcast: Writing Excuses

Find out more about Malina’s appearance at WordCamp Asia 2024 here.

title.rendered: Thanks to Xiuguluan Mountain Sponsor ‚Äì SiteGround

content.rendered:
We’re excited to welcome SiteGround to the WordCamp Asia 2024 team as a valued Xiuguluan Mountain Sponsor. SiteGround, renown for their user friendly hosting solutions, embodies our mission to advance the WordPress ecosystem and drive collaboration, innovation, and inclusivity.

Their sponsorship brings a noteworthy dimension to the WordCamp Asia 2024, showcasing their commitment to delivering stellar hosting experiences for users of different scale – from individuals to businesses. As a trusted ally in the WordPress community, SiteGround’s support paves the way for a fertile intersection of technology and community.

At the event, attendees will have the opportunity to interact with SiteGround experts. Dive into the latest trends in web hosting, learn strategies to elevate your WordPress website’s performance, and discover SiteGround’s trailblazing solutions. Our heartfelt thanks go to SiteGround for their remarkable support, and we encourage all participants to harness this chance to connect, learn, and be inspired.

Let’s show our appreciation for SiteGround, a linchpin in shaping WordCamp Asia 2024 into a notable gathering for WordPress aficionados. With collaboration as our fuel and SiteGround lending power, a breathtaking event awaits us. title.rendered: Exploring the Heart of WordPress: Contributor Stories Unveiled

content.rendered:
Today, we’re taking a closer look at the human side of the WordPress community through “Contributor Stories.” We’re uncovering the personal narratives of the brilliant individuals who generously contribute their time and expertise to elevate WordPress to extraordinary heights.

Prepare to connect with the people behind the code as they share their unique journeys, navigate challenges, and celebrate victories within the ever-evolving WordPress landscape. This post provides a glimpse into the diverse and vibrant community propelling our favorite platform forward. So, find your comfortable spot, and let’s embark on this journey together ‚Äì exploring the faces and stories that truly make WordPress special.

Subhasis Chatterjee

Org Username: quizzycal

Country: India

I‚Äôm a digital content creator and a storyteller from Kolkata, India. My WordPress journey started in 2016 when I started my 2 blogs; one on Travel and another on Food. Later on, I joined the WordPress Kolkata Community in 2019 and started contributing in the domain of content and photos. On any given Contributor Day, I would like to work on how to effectively do blogging using WordPress. Also the types of Blogs and how to decide on what to write, the Anatomy of Blog posts, what to write and Content Marketing strategy, and how to use social media more inclusively.

What I like about WordPress as a development tool is its infinitely configurable stature for supporting my purposes. That‚Äôs the joy of working in WordPress. So, for anyone living online, WP is the best platform for publishing and managing content.

The joy of creating content on WordPress has helped me to connect to the global WordPress communities. Off-late I‚Äôve started attending different WordCamps outside India and thereby constantly in touch with many more amazing WordPressians from different parts of Asia, Europe, and America. I have already been selected as a Speaker in different WordCamps including WordCamp Asia 2023 and for the first time, chosen as one of the Organizers for WordCamp Nepal in January 2024. To add to this glory, on behalf of my Kolkata Community, I‚Äôll be leading one of the GenNext Pilot Projects called Kolkata CareerCamp in December 2023. This is incredible!

Thanks to WordPress for providing me with an amazing experience, camaraderie, and a phenomenal journey!

Dario Jazbec Hrvatin

Org Username: helika

Country: Slovenia

Being able to speak at WordCamp Asia 2023 was such an honor and pleasure! Organization team was incredibly well organized. It was my first trip to Asia ever and this WordCamp will forever stay with me as one of the special experiences in my life. Did I mention that the after party was amazing? üôÇ

Muhibul Haque

Org Username: devmuhib

Country: Bangladesh

Over the past seven years, I’ve passionately crafted my career as a WordPress developer and trying to know the core of this dynamic platform. My journey took an exciting turn when I transitioned myself into a Gutenberg developer, focusing on the future of WordPress content creation. 

From different forums, blogs, and Facebook groups, I learned about WordPress contributions and I entered the world of open-source contribution, which began just a month ago. In this relatively short period, I’ve achieved some remarkable milestones that push me to move forward and contribute more. 

One of my remarkable contributions is contributing on the  “Twenty Twenty Four” block theme, a project that I’m incredibly proud to be a part of. This achievement has not only boosted my confidence but also solidified my commitment to the WordPress community. 

Moreover, I’ve been fortunate to receive recognition in the form of seven batches of appreciation for my contributions, which serve as a constant source of motivation to push my boundaries and contribute even more. 

This contribution journey truly fulfills the invaluable learning experience I gain from collaborating with expert developers in the WordPress ecosystem. Their mentorship and insights continue to shape me into a better developer, and I eagerly anticipate the growth that lies ahead as I continue to contribute to this vibrant community.

Towhidul Islam

Org Username: towhidulislam123

Country: Bangladesh

You might wonder why I dived into WordPress translation. It‚Äôs simple ‚Äì I‚Äôm a firm believer in the magic of local marketing. Just like how you get that warm feeling when your favorite football club posts in multiple languages, I believe websites should speak the language of their audience.

Being a polymath isn‚Äôt just about knowing stuff; it‚Äôs about getting into people‚Äôs shoes (not cleats). Picture this: when they can‚Äôt find support in their own language, it‚Äôs like sending someone to play soccer with a rugby ball – it‚Äôs just not going to end well.

But hey, speaking different languages can be fun too. It‚Äôs like being a language ninja, stealthily bridging the communication gap. It‚Äôs not every day you get to be a translator-superhero. So, I thought, why not give it a shot and contribute to WordPress translation? After all, in the world of websites, we need to keep the ball rolling, or should I say, the website scrolling, in every language imaginable. So, here I am, contributing to WordPress translation, one word at a time, because every language matters in this vast digital world.

Zunaid Amin

Org Username: zunaid321

Country: Bangladesh

‚ÄúI‚Äôve always wanted to leave a digital signature behind me within the open-source ecosystem, I was thankfully able to contribute to WordPress Core to help make it better. This entire experience has simply been amazing. I hope the collective signatures of the WordPress Community will make a better worldwide experience, not just for us but for future generations to come.‚Äù 

Since May 2023, my journey as a WordPress contributor has been nothing short of incredible. It’s been a whirlwind of learning and growth, and I feel truly honored to have the opportunity to give back to the WordPress community, which has given me so much in return.

My involvement with WordPress has been a journey filled with passion and dedication. The WordPress platform has become more than just a tool; it’s a vibrant and dynamic community that fosters creativity and collaboration. Being a part of this community has been a tremendous privilege and an incredibly rewarding experience.

In this short time, my contribution to the WordPress ecosystem has been a remarkable learning curve. From diving into the intricacies of code to engaging with fellow contributors, I’ve expanded my skill set and knowledge in ways I couldn’t have imagined when I began this journey. The support and encouragement I’ve received from the WordPress community have been invaluable in propelling me forward.

I am excited beyond words to share that I’ve received the incredible opportunity to attend WordCamp Asia 2024, sponsored by Rocket.net. This is a dream come true for me, and I am eagerly looking forward to this event. I am profoundly grateful to Rocket.net for their generosity and support, which will undoubtedly enhance my contribution to the WordPress community.

Mayank Kumar

Org Username: markmemayank

Country: India

I used to design websites by using Webnode and Wix when I was in class 8th. In November of 2019, when I was just 16 years old, I learned about WordPress, and I moved from all other platforms to WordPress, which completely changed my life. I was always a tech-lover, so WordPress was something for me.

In 2022, I embarked on an exciting journey into WordCamps. My WordCamp journey began when I attended WordCamp Nagpur 2022 as a Media Partner. This event marked the starting point of my involvement with the vibrant WordPress community. In the same year, I volunteered at WordCamp Kolkata 2022. The experience was exhilarating, allowing me to connect with fellow enthusiasts and seasoned professionals in the field.

Then, I decided to take things further by attending my first meetup in Delhi NCR. As 2023 rolled around, I was determined to make my mark in the WordPress community. I organised my first meetup in Delhi NCR. That was a huge, successful Meetup and my first step toward success.

Then, on the 20th anniversary of WordPress, I joined the team of WordPress Delhi NCR Community. As the year progressed, I continued to expand my involvement within the community. In July 2023, I joined the Photo Mod Team, further enhancing my role as a contributor to the WordPress Photo Directory project.

And finally, in a thrilling turn of events, I was honoured to be a speaker at WordCamp Bengaluru 2023. Sharing my knowledge and insights with an eager audience was a testament to how far I had come in my WordPress journey. To top it all off, I took on the role of Photos Team Lead at WordCamp Bhopal 2023.

And now I am running two successful ed-tech startups, JNVST Prep (100K+ visitors per month) and CSHUB (30K+ visitors per month), and obviously, these both are up and running with WordPress only.

From attending WordCamps and meetups to becoming an organiser, speaker, media partner, volunteer, and team lead, my journey through the WordPress community has been an incredible adventure. With each milestone, I have grown as a WordPress enthusiast, and I look forward to many more years of contributing to this dynamic and ever-evolving ecosystem.

Kinjal Dalwadi

Org Username: kinjaldalwadi

Country: India

I am an active member of the Ahmedabad WordPress community in India. I firmly believe that the best way to predict the future is to create it together. Returning to the community brings happiness through giving.

My WordPress journey began in 2012, and I’ve been actively contributing since 2018. My first contribution was to the Plugins channel, providing an awesome experience as I watched installations and activated plugins grow.

The encouragement from seeing those numbers led me to deepen my involvement in the community, earning badges on my wp.org profile. I expanded my contributions to Polyglots and Core channels, enjoying the structured process with its rules and flaws.

I’ve had the privilege of attending national and international WordCamps, where I participated as a speaker and volunteered. For me, togetherness is not just a destination; it’s the ongoing journey of contributing and rising together. Let’s continue to contribute and thrive together.

title.rendered: Behind The Lineup: Robert Li

content.rendered:
As we countdown to WordCamp Asia 2024, each week we‚Äôre inviting you to go behind the lineup and get to know the folks who will be taking to the stage. In today‚Äôs post, we chat with Robert Li, APAC Automator in Chief & currently Principal Solutions Engineer for WP Engine.

Q. Firstly, welcome to the lineup! We‚Äôre so glad to have you here. Can you start by telling us a bit about yourself? Where will you be joining the event from, and what does your day-to-day look like?

I come from Brisbane, Australia. Honestly, I have a pretty regimented day. Typically it starts at around 5am, where I normally go for a run before anything. Then I’ll either commute or work from home 2-3 days a week. I go to the gym after work 6 days a week and then I’m promptly to bed at 9-10pm. 

My work day typically consists of morning meetings with my US colleagues before a morning stand-up with my team locally. Throughout the day think of my responsibilities in 3 buckets:

BAU‚ÄîThis is crunching reports to help our sales team with their customer accounts, doing health checks and providing architectural or optimization recommendations

Internal Projects‚ÄîThis is working on tasks in support of our platform and engineering teams, whether that’s helping with tooling, product management, or fact-finding the better understand our customers

Special Projects‚ÄîThese are personal projects that I will be working on ad-hoc, case in point, the upcoming presentation for WordCamp Asia 2024!

Q. We‚Äôre lucky to be welcoming a diverse range of speakers to our program in 2024. What interested you to apply to WordCamp Asia as a speaker?

WordCamp Asia is the premier regional WordCamp in our region, so I am honoured to be selected to speak.

Taiwan is also a particularly special place for myself and my partner. My partner was born and raised in Fuzhou which is literally only a couple hundred kilometers away from Taipei and so she and I have a great affinity with the food and culture here.

We are particularly big fans of fried taro balls from the Ningxia night market. That’s why I applied to speak at WordCamp. So I could eat fried taro balls at night.

Q. What can audiences expect to learn from your talk/s? Are there any advance sneak peeks or knowledge bombs you can offer us?

My talk will give a high level overview of generative AI and LLMs, as well as how I believe the capabilities of these LLMs will be eventually integrated with WordPress, content editorial workflows and development practices. 

But, probably most interesting to attendees is, I’ll also be giving a brief demo of an end to end proof of concept from exporting data from your WordPress site to creating a retrieval augmented generative chatbot or form fill where you can query that data using a large language model with an accompanying Colab Notebook so attendees can follow along after.

Q. What are you most looking forward to at WordCamp Asia 2024? Is there someone you‚Äôre looking forward to rubbing shoulder with, or a local delicacy you‚Äôd like to sample? 

I love meeting all the different people at WordCamp, some of the brightest thinkers and biggest influences on the ecosystem. I love learning about upcoming developments and I love fried taro balls.

Q. Tell us something about yourself that we might not know. Party tricks? Secret hobbies?

You’re going to see this in the presentation but… I’m an avid baker. I have a 200 year old sourdough starter and apparently my sourdough loaf is pretty good.

Q. Lightning Round!¬†

Most-visited website: Duckduckgo, otherwise shoutout to MarkTechPost.com.

Must-have gadget: Logically it’s my Pixel phone, but… I have a soft spot for my Anbernic RG405v. I just realised I could do Steam Link with it and play Death must Die on it!

Most-read book: Three Body Problem by Liu Cixin.

Go-to podcast: Hard Fork.


Find out more about Robert‚Äôs appearance at WordCamp Asia 2024 here.

title.rendered: WordCamp Asia Diversity Scholarship

content.rendered:
Last year, we collaborated with WordCamp Central to offer a scholarship and the experience was very well received. This year, we’re tapping into the overall sponsorship fund to continue the diversity scholarship.

Why Scholarship?

We started WordCamp Asia years ago with a belief that we can gather the world’s best speakers and bring them to Asia reducing the cost of participation for residents here. This is still not enough for many of our fellow asian residents. Issues such as difficulty in obtaining a travel visa and the high cost of travel due to the foreign exchange rate are especially present for many asian countries’ citizens.

We want to help where we can.

Who Qualifies?

This scholarship is awarded to someone who:

  • Is an active WordPress project contributor.
  • Has never attended any flagship WordCamps (Asia, US or Europe) before.
  • Requires financial assistance to attend.
  • Is part of the underrepresented demography of open-source contributors.
  • Is interested in bringing their experience to grow their local WordPress community and/or WordPress community in Asia.

Bonus point: If you can share your Contributor Story, it‚Äôll help us understand your background better!¬†

Selection

We are awarding the scholarship to 2 individuals provided they meet the requirements.

  • An out of country attendee
  • A local resident of Taiwan

This scholarship provides financial assistance for the recipient to attend WordCamp Asia 2024, including travel from the recipient‚Äôs home city, accommodation for the duration of the event, and a ticket to WordCamp Asia.

The selection will be performed by a small panel consisting of WordCamp Central program managers.

If you’re interested, please fill in the application form by February 2, 2024. All candidates will be informed by February, 9 2024.

Application Form

You can read about last year’s award recipient here.

title.rendered: Webinar Summary: Travel to Taiwan with Ease

content.rendered:
If you couldn’t attend our January 11, 2024, webinar on helpful tips for planning your trip to Taiwan, don’t worry. We’ve compiled all the relevant information, along with a recorded video and a Q&A segment for easy access. 

During the webinar, we covered key topics such as the eVisa application process, advice on booking accommodations, and essential travel information like weather conditions, SIM card options, transportation, and currency exchange. You are welcome to explore the video recording to access this valuable information at your convenience. 

Slideshow
Watch Webinar Recording

Visa Information 

To start, determine the visa you need based on your country of origin. If you are not from a visa-exempt country or eligible for an ROC Authorized Certificate, you have two options:

  1. Visitor Visa for Attending Conference
  2. eVisa 

If you opt for an eVisa through WordCamp Asia, please follow the specific application process. For detailed information, refer to the visa page or our webinar video.

4 Tips for finding accommodations in Taiwan

  1. Choosing the right area to stay: Location is key for a convenient and enjoyable trip. 
  2. Different Types of Accommodations & their pros and cons: Understand your options to make the best choice.
  3. Things to Consider When Booking a Place: Important factors to keep in mind.
  4. Securing the Best Price: Strategies for finding affordable accommodations.

Important Information While Traveling in Taiwan

This section covers crucial travel tips:

  • Payments and Currency Exchange: How to handle money transactions.
  • Staying Connected: Information on SIM cards, Wi-Fi, and power outlets.
  • Local Travel Secrets: Discover unique and lesser-known spots.
  • Additional Tips: Weather, tipping etiquette, cultural norms, and restrictions.

We’ve also prepared more travel information to help you explore Taipei and ensure a delightful journey!

  • Muslim-friendly information
  • Where to eat
  • Transportation Guide
  • 9 Useful Apps in Taiwan
  • Free Tours in Taipei
  • Taiwan Lucky Draw

Q&A

Travel Related Questions

Are there customs we need to be aware of when interacting with locals? E.g. when meeting people (for the first time)

In Taiwan, while there are no stringent customs, it’s important to note that using the middle finger is widely regarded as rude. Additionally, not everyone may be comfortable with handshakes, hugs, or cheek kisses; a nod and a smile can serve as a polite greeting. Beyond this, maintaining a friendly demeanor with smiles goes a long way. You’ll find that people are generally very welcoming and friendly.

My flight ticket says Taipei – Terminal 1. Which airport would that be?

“Taipei” here means Taoyuan International Airport (TPE) . Please refer to our “Location” page for airport info

Are tips mandatory in Taiwan?

There’s no need to tip in Taiwan, but a service charge of 5-10% will be added to the final bill at some restaurants.

Will there be any 220v power supply available at WordCamp Asia premises, or every one need to purchase converter from 220v to 110v?

You will have to bring your own, but most chargers for laptops and cell phones are fine.

How do we travel with luggage city to city on high speed trains. Would there be place to keep 1-2 checkin bags on the train.

There’s suitcase compartments on high speed rails for large ones. For carry-ons, you can put in front of your legs or overhead spaces.

Are we allowed to drink outside?

Yes!

Which airport do you recommend?

Songshan Airport is located in Taipei but not many flights go there. Most international flights go to Taoyuan International Airport. Please refer to the Location Page for more information.

Can we use AMEX in Taipei?

Not every place takes AMEX in Taipei.

Is there a rental bicycles in Taipei?

There’s a shared bike called Youbike in Taipei, and it’s very easy to find and use. Please refer to our “Get Around in Taipei” page for more information.

Are the toilets safe in Taipei? Can we flush the toilet papers?

Some toilets are not allowed to throw in toilet paper. Please follow the instruction of the sign in the restroom.

Will there be emergency medical help provided at the venue?

Yes, there will be.

Is there an ATM at the WCAsia venue?

Yes. ATM are also located at MRT stations and convenience stores.

Does WordCamp Asia provide WiFi at the venue?

Yes, there will be WiFi.

What are the other popular cab or taxi apps?

Besides Uber, you can also use Yoxi or 55688, but it’s easier to use Uber.

Are the convenience stores open 24 hours?

Most of them are open 24/7.

what kind of converter to bring? do you have any recommendation?

Anything that can plug in to A/B type outlet would work.

How much cash should we carry? Any suggested amounts to cover airport taxi up n down to venue and basic subsistence?

It really depends on the length of your trip and lifestyle. The taxi ride from Taoyuan International Airport to the venue costs around NT$1,200 (approx. 40 USD) A normal meal can be NT$150-500 ($5-18USD) per person.

Can I buy the EasyCard with credit card? How can you get the Easy card? Where to purchase it?

No. EasyCard can be purchased at all MRT stations and convenience stores with cash.

Is there a name for the Sim Card? I presume it is easily identified Kiosk at the airport right?

It’s easy to see in the airport. There are Chunghwa, FETnet, and Taiwan Mobile.

Is Uber available in Taipei?

Yes, Uber is easy to get in Taipei.

Do you have tips for the mobile companies?

If you stay in the city, most of the mobile services would be good, but if you go into mountains, for example, Chunghwa has the widest coverage.

What is the weather in Taiwan?

In early March, it will be between 15 to 22 celcius. It should be very nice with low chance of rain. But the tropical climate is unpredictable.

Visa Related Questions

Can I apply for family visa by ending of this month with my own eVisa application?

We recommend submitting all of your family’s eVisa applications at the same time as a group. In each eVisa application, you can indicate that it should be considered as part of a group application and use the same group name for all of them.

If there are restrictions to stay in Airbnb, or service apartments, then what is the purpose of Gold card, how we can stay for a long time (3 years) in hotels?

The Gold Card is an employment visa that allows you to reside in Taiwan based on the duration of your Gold Card (1/2/3 years). If you are planning to stay in Taiwan for an extended period, you may prefer renting a house or apartment instead of staying in expensive hotels or using third-party booking platforms.

All type of hotel and airlines are accepted? Or any recommendation?

There are no restrictions on which hotels or airlines to choose when applying for visas. However, please exercise caution when booking through third-party platforms, as some listings may not be legal.

If I’m going to apply for eVisa via WordCamp Asia, do I still need to download visa letter?

No, you do not need to download visa letter. We will issue visa letter for you with detailed flight information and accommodation.

Where is the eVisa application form link to apply via WordCamp Asia?

You will find eVisa application link in your ticket confirmation email. If you purchased tickets in first 3 batches, please email us at aisa-local@wordcamp.org.

In the eVisa application Google form that was sent via email, I do not see option to upload ticket email pdf, will you guys fetch it with email and name?

Yes, we will look up your ticket information on the official website and cross-check your details.

For eVisa do we need to verify documents from notary or from ROC embassy?

No, document verification is not required when applying through WordCamp Asia. However, if MOFA requests document verification after we submit your application, please follow their guidelines.

For the eVisa application, should I upload the bio page of my new passport or is the old one also required?

We only accept current passports, so please ensure that your passport has a validity of at least 6 months.

Do I have to write my full name on the event ticket? I don‚Äôt want to show my full legal name on the badge.

It is necessary to include your full name on the event ticket, including your middle name. This requirement is in place because the visa letter is valid only when it is attached to the event ticket. Please ensure that your name on the ticket, visa letter, and passport all match. If you prefer not to display your full name on the badge, you can utilize the ‘Name on the badge’ field in the ticket. You can then select ‘What information you want printed on the Event Badge QR’ to display only the information you choose.

Me and my husband got the WordCamp ticket, so we can apply for eVisa via Flexible Mechanism Process, but how can I get the visa for my 4 years old daughter?

Children can also apply for eVisa. Please ensure that when submitting each application, you apply as a group. Children under 12 do not need to purchase a ticket. Additionally, please fill in your children’s school name in the “Company/Institution/Organization” field.

We had Gold Card Webinar Last week, do we need a visa in addition to Gold Card or this is only for those who can’t apply for Gold Card.

Please note that there is no conflict in applying for a Gold Card and a visa at the same time. The Gold Card itself grants unlimited visa entries, so if you are approved for a Gold Card, you do not need to apply for another visa.

I hold a Chinese passport. Which visa should I apply for?

You will need to apply for a business visa for attending the conference. Please email us at asia-local@wordcamp.org, and we will connect you to our Taiwan representative entity, Open Culture Foundation. They will assist you with the visa process. For detailed visa information, you can refer to this link.

I need a visa letter for Visitor Visa for Attending Conference. How do I get it?

You can download the visa letter from: https://wpasia.org/visa-letter/

I am coming from India and I am not eligible to apply for an ROC Travel Authorization Certificate. So we applied through WordCamp Asia. Is that the correct way?

If you are not eligible for the ROC Travel Authorization Certificate, you still have two options: the Visitor Visa for Attending Conference and MOFA’s eVisa Program Flexible Mechanism. Each option has different requirements and processes, so it’s important to choose the one that best suits your travel plans and circumstances. You can find a comparison table for these two options on the visa page here.

title.rendered: Webinar Summary: Intro of Taiwan Employment Gold Card

content.rendered:
We’re thrilled to share the highlights from our recent webinar on the Taiwan Employment Gold Card, a vital session for those aspiring to seek business opportunities in Taiwan. Integral to our WordCamp Asia 2024 initiatives, the webinar was enriched by the expertise of Jonathan Liao (Director of the Taiwan Employment Gold Card Office) and Anita Chen (Director of DIGI Gold Card Community). Their insights were crucial in demystifying the Gold Card process and its advantages.

Slideshow
Watch Webinar Recording

The webinar aimed to clarify the Taiwan Employment Gold Card application process, covering essential steps, benefits, and offering practical advice. Our Q&A session addressed a variety of questions, including how to request a Letter of Guarantee and the process of bringing family to Taiwan with a Gold Card visa.

For comprehensive details on the Gold Card, check out our dedicated page here. This resource offers in-depth information to guide you through the process.

Thank you to all who joined the webinar. Your participation and engagement are what make our community vibrant and diverse.

We wish you a successful journey towards obtaining your Taiwan Employment Gold Card!

Q&A

Need guide of Document Verification and Letter of guarantee. How can we know which kind of qualification documents should be verified by Embassy?

Certificates related to employment, salary, education, etc., issued by the following countries/regions: Afghanistan, Algeria, Bengal, Bhutan, Myanmar, Cambodia, Cameroon, Cuba, Ghana, Iran, Iraq, Laos, Nepal, Niger, Nigeria, Pakistan, Senegal, Somalia, Sri Lanka, Syria, Philippines, Thailand, Vietnam, Malaysia, and Indonesia, need to be authenticated by Taiwan (ROC) representative office / Embassy in that country or a neighboring country. (Unless those issued by multinational corporation with a subsidiary/parent company in Taiwan, could be accepted.) If the provided documents are not in English or Chinese, please attach a translation to English or Chinese. Please find further process via link.

Is the Letter of guarantee a necessary item and could we request the authority to help finish this form?

If you are a sponsor, speaker, volunteer, table lead, or organizer of WordCamp Asia 2024, you can request the Letter of Guarantee from us. If you are an attendee of WordCamp Asia 2024, we will review based on your contribution to WordPress. Please contact asia-local@wordcamp.org.

I have summitted and paid for the application. But my documents haven‚Äôt been verified, what is the process and how could we apply for document verification?

Once applicants received notification email to upload additional documents, the reviewing agency would point out which document should be verified by Taiwan embassy, please refer to response of question 1 and do so in a timely manner.

During the fact there is no Taiwan Embassy in some countries. Could Document Verification and Passport Inspection done by travel agents or via sending mail?

We recommend contacting or emailing the documents requiring verification to the designated overseas representative office of the Taiwan embassy. Confirm whether personal presence is necessary or if it is permissible to appoint a representative. Contact points of each Taiwan embassy here.

Is filling out the Resume provided on Gold Card official website a MUST? Or could applicants prepare open platform profile such as WordPress.org, LinkedIn, GitHub, Dribbble, portfolio website, etc be proof of seniority?

We suggest the completion of the Resume form on Gold Card website as the cover for all of your supporting documents. This will provide reviewing agencies with a clearer understanding of the applicant’s personal experience and expedite the review process. In addition to the resume, applicants should also prepare employment certificates, open platform profiles, and other qualification proofs as reviewing documents.

If I receive the Gold Card, do I have to go to Taiwan alone to collect it, or can my spouse and child accompany me on the first entry?

Your spouse and children can enter Taiwan with a Visa-Exempt Entry or the Visitor Visa or Resident Visa for the reason of family reunion, issued by the ROC (Taiwan) overseas mission. When they enter Taiwan. Please find further regulations here.

DON’T buy via the third-party payment platform. Does it mean; buy directly only from the Airline website for flight & Hotel website for stay?

Please book your itinerary through a travel agency in your country, a Taiwanese travel agency, or directly on the official website of the airline/hotel.

I am from Pakistan but live in Malaysia and have Ph.D. (CS) from Malaysia, (ranked 129th). Should I send PhD certificate to the Taiwan Embassy in Malaysia?

Yes

Does the “Over 8 years in the digital sector” for the Taiwan Gold Card include Freelancing/solopreneur or is it only valid if the person is with a company?

If applicants are freelancing or operating as solopreneurs, please complete the resume form on Gold Card website for clarification. Additionally, plase attach documents such as company registration certificates, service contracts, and a portfolio on an open platform as proof of employment.

Are we still eligible for the incentive program if we have already booked flights using a third party?

Yes, please note that if you purchase flight tickets through third-party platforms, a 20% tax will be deducted from the total incentive amount. Also, accomadation vouchers and receipts issued by foreign e-commerce platforms are not accepted.

If you the 3 years has completed do you need to renew the gold card before you can apply for permanent resident status?

Gold Card holders are eligible to apply for permanent residency after three years. The requirements include: helding a Gold Card for at least three years, having stayed in Taiwan as a Gold Card holder for three consecutive years or more, and having resided in Taiwan for an average of 183 days or more per year. Then you could apply APRC at immgration agency. Check detailed regulations here.

Would the Taiwan Entrepreneur Visa be more suitable for freelancers?

One of the obligations for Taiwan Entrepreneur Visa holders is to establish a local business before the visa expires.While Gold Card requires no limitations for talents and freelancers, allowing them to either be employed full-time or open businesses in Taiwan. This provides the flexibility to explore various business opportunities under favorable conditions.

What are the additional service fees to accommodate the Gold Card applications to evaluate to check the eligibility? Other than the Gold Card government fee? (edited)

No additional service fees, both help desk from Taiwan Gold Card Office (help@taiwangoldcard.tw) and DIGI Gold Card Community (hello@digigoldcard.tw) are here and free for you to inquiry for Gold Card and matters in Taiwan.

If I need help with the Taiwan Gold Card application, can I get help from the WCAsia team?

Please visit our Gold Card Page introducing gold card in digital field. You could fill out 1on1 service form and contact DIGI Gold Card Community for application of Gold Card. If you are a sponsor, speaker, volunteer, table lead, or organizer of WordCamp Asia 2024, you can request the Letter of Guarantee from us. If you are an attendee of WordCamp Asia 2024, we will review based on your contribution to WordPress. Please contact asia-local@wordcamp.org.

Can you talk about the criteria for renewing the gold card and what that process is like?

You may extend your Employment Gold Card on the Foreign Professionals Online Application Platform within 4 months of your current card‚Äôs expiration date. After re-entering your personal information, the platform will automatically transfer your documents from your previous application (you will not be able to preview or download your previous documents). Please check the detailed regulations here.

Can apply Gold Card directly for 3 years or it will be renewable on a yearly basis?

Applicants could choose Gold Card duration from 1-3 years. The Gold Card is also renewable.

Do different categories/buckets have different quotas? If a candidate qualifies for several categories, what would you recommend for the strongest application?

We welcome everyone to explore and consider which field of Gold Card qualification fits you best. We also recommend applying for the digital field if the qualifications align with your profile. This is the field where we can assist in guiding you through the application and review process, keeping track of your progress.

Can apply for the Gold card with family (Husband and one 4 years old kid)

Your spouse and children can enter Taiwan with a Visa-Exempt Entry or the Visitor Visa or Resident Visa for the reason of family reunion, issued by the ROC (Taiwan) overseas mission. (Resident Visa for Spouse and Resident Visa for Children) When they enter Taiwan. Please find further regulations here.

The chosen Wapuu for WordCamp Asia 2024 resonates with the richness of Asian culture and the region’s technological advancement, seamlessly merging traditional aesthetics with a modern, digital vibe. 

A big thank you to all participants for showcasing your incredible talents and contributing to the WordPress community’s vibrant culture. We can’t wait for you to meet Wapuu at WordCamp Asia 2024!

content.rendered:
We would like to express our immense gratitude to three amazing sponsors ‚Äì InstaWP, StellarWP, and WPointer, as we gear up for WordCamp Asia 2024. Their unwavering support has played a crucial role in ensuring that this event, taking place from March 7-9 at the Taipei International Convention Center (TICC), will be nothing short of extraordinary.

InstaWP allows you to take site production into your own hands by offering a staging site solution that empowers WordPress developers and designers to do their best work without affecting the production environment ahead of a team’s upcoming launch. Their forward-thinking products for WordPress site developers will be a treat for the WordCamp Asia crowd.

StellarWP, presents a diverse range of WordPress plugins with more than 2.5 million installations, crafted to elevate website functionality and user experience. From SolidWP to GiveWP, StellarWP empowers WordPress users to effortlessly enhance their websites for a superior online presence.

WPointer is dedicated to WordPress education, offering a free “Five-Day Get-Started Course,” guiding beginners in creating their first WordPress website with daily one-hour lessons. In addition to online tutorials, WPointer‚Äôs founder, Erin Lin, has also published a new book, ‚ÄúMonetizing Side Hustles with WordPress‚Äù, which is an essential guide for WordPress beginners.

We extend our sincere thanks to StellarWP and WPointer for their generous sponsorship. Together, we are creating an event that will undoubtedly leave a lasting impact on the WordPress community. We look forward to seeing you at TICC for WordCamp Asia 2024!

  • InstaWP is a must-have tool for every WordPress developer and designer. With it, you can create a WordPress Sandbox site to test, build, and deploy to a hosting provider of your choice.¬†

    Want to adopt modern methodology for WordPress Development, or wish to offer Website as a Service (WaaS) to your clients? There is no better aid than InstaWP for it. Our tool is great for all kinds of WordPress users, especially agencies, designers, developers, enterprises, and entrepreneurs. 

    Re-imagine your development workflow through instantly-created test sites instantly with your custom configurations, settings, and pre-installed themes and plugins. Our templates and template store will help you reuse, repurpose and refine your WP site‚Äôs UI.

    10 use cases that will help you understand InstaWP better:

    1. Build staging sites and connect with any hosting provider. 
    2. Showcase your plugins and themes on demo sites.
    3. Demonstrate your plugins or themes to end-users effectively
    4. Launch staging sites with SSL certificates for added security
    5. Collaborate with your team members and clients on WordPress projects.
    6. Test WP.org plugins and themes without installing them on your site.
    7. Switch between WordPress and PHP versions instantly. 
    8. Get SSH and SFTP access to your sites. 
    9. Migrate your site and perform domain mapping quickly.
    10. Manage GitOps without any trouble

    Swiftly delivers WordPress projects without compromising performance, security, flexibility, and collaboration levels. Be truly agile with our easy-to-use freemium tool.

    Always remember, InstaWP is free to use so that you can test the intuitive dashboard and its features.

title.rendered: Announcing Our Second Invited Speaker – Noel Tock

content.rendered:
We are excited to welcome Noel Tock as our next invited speaker for WordCamp Asia 2024. With a career spanning over two decades in digital experiences, Noel brings a wealth of knowledge and insight to the event.

About Noel Tock

Noel has been building digital experiences since 1995, having built numerous online communities in the early days of the web as well as an award-winning game. In 2010, he co-founded Human Made, one of the world‚Äôs leading WordPress companies. There, he advises large enterprise clients on how to build engaging platforms, by fusing open-source and innovative technologies for lasting value. He‚Äôs now using this experience to also volunteer in the recovery of Ukraine, hoping to make a difference through humanitarian technology.

Through its enterprise agency services and hosting, Human Made which is still independently owned to this day, helps deliver over 20B+ pageviews per year and is committed to the ongoing growth and success of WordPress and open-source.

Session Details

Noel‚Äôs session will focus around the future of WordPress largely in the context of AI and what it means for our industry. Expect to understand how you can best position yourself and your business to not only continue to be successful, but also ensure WordPress‚Äôs longevity in this space.

title.rendered: Contributor Day Registration

content.rendered:
As we prepare for WordCamp Asia 2024, we’re excited to share some great news about a crucial event that will enhance your WordPress journey‚ÄîContributor Day. Taking place on the first day, March 7, 2024, at the Taipei International Convention Center (TICC) in Taiwan, Contributor Day welcomes you to join in shaping the future of the WordPress platform as an active participant.

What is Contributor Day?

Contributor Day is not just an event; it’s a unique opportunity for you to roll up your sleeves and contribute to various facets of the WordPress project. Guided by top-tier WordPress people in the world, this day allows you to make a tangible impact, regardless of your experience or skill level. Visit our Contributor Day page for more details.

Event Details:

Date: March 7, 2024

Location: Taipei International Convention Center (TICC), Taiwan

Limited Seating Alert!

To ensure an intimate and engaging experience, we have limited seating to 450 participants. Registration for Contributor Day will open its doors on December 18, 2023. 

Because of the limited seating capacity, we’re exclusively sending the Contributor Day registration link to those who confirmed their attendance during the WCAsia ticket purchase. If you fall into this category, be sure to check your email for the registration link on Monday, December 18, 2023.

We are eager to bring together a diverse group of contributors to collectively enhance the WordPress project. If you’ve ever wanted to play a role in shaping the platform you love, Contributor Day is your chance.

So get ready for more updates as we get closer to the big day. Your journey into the heart of WordPress is starting soon, where you’ll learn from the best. And don’t worry if you make mistakes ‚Äì it’s okay! What you contribute might be in the next WordPress version. Don’t miss the chance to sit down with top WordPress people and make a difference at Contributor Day!

title.rendered: How to Convince Your Boss to Send You to WordCamp Asia

content.rendered:
Are you eyeing the upcoming WordCamp Asia 2024 but hesitating because it falls on weekdays? Here‚Äôs how to make a compelling case to your boss about why attending this event is not just beneficial for you, but a strategic move for your company.

1. The Significance of WordCamp Asia

WordCamp Asia, one of the flagship WordCamps in the world, is a prestigious gathering in the WordPress and web community. It is where the best minds in the open source field converge to share insights and innovations. Convey to your boss that this isn’t just another conference‚Äîit‚Äôs the epicenter of learning and networking.¬†

2. Direct Benefits to Your Role

Scan the event schedule and pinpoint sessions that align with your current projects or skills you want to enhance. Explain to your boss how these sessions are directly relevant to your work and will aid in your professional development. 

3. Company-wide Advantages:

Attending WordCamp Asia isn‚Äôt just about your personal growth. Emphasize the broad spectrum of benefits the company stands to gain‚Äîfrom insights into upcoming technologies and trends, to networking opportunities that might lead to potential collaborations or hires. 

4. Aligning with Company Objectives:

Tailor your proposal to resonate with your company‚Äôs goals. If your company is seeking new talent, mention your aim to scout potential candidates. If it‚Äôs about expanding networks, highlight your plan to connect with key players and potential partners at the event.

5. Practical Tips for Your Proposal:

When you approach your boss, be prepared with a detailed plan. This includes a budget breakdown and understanding your company‚Äôs current focus to align your goals with the event.

6. Crafting Your Email Pitch:

Use the provided template as a starting point for your email to your boss. Personalize it to reflect your enthusiasm for the event and how it aligns with your professional and the company‚Äôs objectives. 

Email template

Subject: Proposal for Attending WordCamp Asia – A Strategic Opportunity

Dear [Boss’s Name],

I am writing to discuss a significant professional development opportunity – WordCamp Asia, a premier open source web summit, scheduled from March 7-9, 2024.¬†

WordCamp Asia offers a unique platform for learning and networking, featuring industry-leading speakers and sessions. By attending, I aim to gain insights and skills directly applicable to our current projects, particularly [mention specific projects or areas of 

work].

The event aligns perfectly with our company’s objectives, such as [mention specific company goals or projects]. Attending will enable me to network with potential partners, explore new technologies, and bring back innovative ideas that could benefit our team and company. 

I would appreciate the opportunity to discuss this further and answer any questions you may have. Thank you for considering my request. I look forward to the possibility of representing [Company’s Name] at this influential event.

Best regards,

[Your Name]

7. Seizing the Opportunity:

Remember, if you don‚Äôt ask, the answer will always be no. Emphasize the unique opportunity that WordCamp Asia presents and how its benefits extend beyond just personal gains to substantial company growth.

WordCamp Asia is more than just an event; it’s a hub of knowledge, networking, and growth opportunities.

By attending, you’re not just enhancing your own skills but also bringing back invaluable insights and connections to your company. So go ahead, make your case, and get ready to be part of an event that could shape the future of your professional journey and your company‚Äôs trajectory in the future of the web. 

Get Your Tickets Today

title.rendered: Announcing Our First Speaker – Matt Mullenweg

content.rendered:
WordCamp Asia 2024 is thrilled to unveil the first speaker of our upcoming event, a visionary in the world of web technology and digital publishing ‚Äì Matt Mullenweg.

About Matt Mullenweg

Matt Mullenweg, renowned as the co-founder of WordPress, has significantly influenced the digital landscape. WordPress is the backbone of over one-third of all websites on the internet today. This open-source publishing platform has revolutionized content management and website creation, making it accessible to millions worldwide.

Beyond WordPress, Matt’s entrepreneurial journey extends as the founder and CEO of Automattic. This influential company operates WordPress.com, Woo, Tumblr, WPVIP, Day One,  Pocket Casts, and Texts, all platforms that embrace the open source ethos and have profoundly impacted how we interact with digital content. In addition, Matt also helms Audrey Capital, an investment and research firm.

Opportunity to Engage

Matt’s expertise and insights into web development, content management, and digital innovation are unparalleled. The session at WordCamp Asia 2024 is a not-to-be-missed opportunity for attendees to learn from one of the industry’s most influential figures.

Session Details

The session is planned to be hosted on March 9th at 4 PM in the Plenary Hall. This will be an invaluable opportunity for WordPress enthusiasts, developers, content creators, and digital marketers to gain insights directly from a leading figure in the field.

Stay Tuned for more information

Stay tuned as we announce additional information about the session’s topic. We’re dedicated to making this an enriching experience for all attendees.

Keep an eye on our blog and social media channels for the latest updates on WordCamp Asia 2024, including speaker announcements, session details, and more. We’re just as excited as you are to bring this incredible event to life!

Get Your Tickets Now

title.rendered: Discover the Taiwan Gold Card in Digital Field: Your Gateway to Opportunities in Taiwan

content.rendered:
Ready to come to Taiwan for WordCamp Asia 2024?

Are you a digital talent looking to explore new horizons? If so, Taiwan is calling your name with its exceptional Taiwan Digital Field Gold Card program. Let’s dive into what makes this opportunity a golden ticket for professionals like you.¬†

What is the Taiwan Gold Card in Digital Field?

The Taiwan Ministry of Digital Affairs (moda) has crafted an exclusive program designed for international digital experts. This Gold Card is not just a visa ‚Äì it’s a comprehensive package that offers unparalleled access to Taiwan’s vibrant tech scene, including events such as WordCamp Asia 2024. You will get benefits such as work permit, resident visa, re-entry permit, travel incentives and more with the Gold Card.¬†

Note: You are not required to obtain a job or operate a business in Taiwan to meet the Gold Card requirements. By attending WordCamp Asia, you fulfill the obligation of the Gold Card incentive program.

Partnership with Taipei Computer Association (TCA) 

We’re excited to announce that WordCamp Asia is partnering with Digital Field Gold Card program implementer, Taipei Computer Association, a leading industrial organization in Taiwan with 4,000 entities across the information communication technology (ICT) industry. This collaboration aims to make your experience even more seamless. With this partnership, we will ensure that your Gold Card application process is smooth and efficient. Additionally, TCA provides personalized 1-on-1 consultations and assistance throughout your application journey, making it easier and faster for you to join us in Taiwan.¬†

If you meet any of these criteria, you’re eligible:

  • Over 8 years in the digital sector.
  • Earning at least NT$160,000 monthly.
  • A graduate from a top 500 university with a doctoral degree.
  • Hold relevant expertise and certifications.

The Taiwan Gold Card in Digital Field is more than just a work permit; it’s a gateway to a plethora of opportunities in one of Asia’s most dynamic tech landscapes. Don’t miss this chance to be a part of Taiwan’s digital revolution!¬†

Learn more about Taiwan Gold Card in Digital Fields

title.rendered: Call for Sponsors Extended to November 30th

content.rendered:
Dear WordPress Asia Community,

While we had officially closed the Call for Sponsors on October 15th, we have received various points of feedback from potential sponsors around their reasons for not sponsoring which is inclusive of:

  • Visa availability
  • Team member logistics
  • 2024 budget planning still underway

This back and forth continued past the deadline, and while some folks were able to gain clarity, it also meant that they were unable to submit their application on time.

Therefore, we will be extending the Call for Sponsors until Thursday, November 30th. 

WordCamp Asia strives to connect the WordPress APAC community with the world, and due to the above factors, the sponsors organizing team felt that we would be doing the event a disservice by not giving these potential sponsors a chance to apply.

Applicants can review our offerings and apply from the sponsorship packages page. We are still currently confirming commitments, so please feel free to input a sold out package in your backup package slot for consideration. 

Please also review the updated visa information page, and feel free to reach out to the team at asia-sponsors@wordcamp.org with any additional questions.

Thank you,
WordCamp Asia 2024 Sponsors Team

After a successful event in Bangkok in 2023 and the upcoming 2024 WordCamp Asia in Taipei (March 7-9), we’re searching for our next 2025 location. Could your city be the next big spot for the WordPress community?

Running WordCamp Asia is a team effort, combining experienced organizers from across Asia and local WordPress fans. If your local community is active, and you’ve had a WordCamp in your city in the last four years, you might be our next host. We’re looking for cities with teams of eight or more organizers.

Our selection team, composed of experienced WordCamp organizers, will review all applications. If your city is chosen, you’ll hear from us, and we’ll announce the 2025 host city at the end of our Taipei event in 2024.

Are you excited to bring WordCamp Asia to your city in 2025? We can’t wait to find out where we’re heading next!

content.rendered:
We understand that traveling to Taiwan can be challenging for attendees from certain countries, but we’re dedicated to simplifying the eVisa application process. Our collaboration with government organizations has streamlined the application, eliminating unnecessary hurdles.

Regardless of your country of origin, if you are not eligible for Visa-Exempt Entry or the ROC Travel Authorization Certificate, you can apply for a special eVisa through WordCamp Asia, no matter which country you come from.¬†

You do NOT need to visit an embassy to obtain an eVisa.

Check the requirements and process here

But we‚Äôre not stopping there!

We want you to be part of this transformative journey. Do you have an ideal speaker in mind for WordCamp Asia? Or a specific topic you’re keen to explore? We invite you to share your insights.

Fill out the form below to make your recommendation. Every suggestion is invaluable to us. Additionally, we’re committed to sharing our findings with other flagship events, continuously enhancing the WordCamp experience for all.

Let’s collaborate and make WordCamp Asia a landmark event!

title.rendered: Call for Sponsors Is Now Open

content.rendered:
Why sponsor WordCamp Asia 2024?

During the world‚Äôs first WordCamp Asia in 2023 we saw a phenomenal turnout of 1299 attendees, a number rivaling that of other flagship WordCamps. Sponsors and attendees alike voiced wide appreciation for the event, with sponsors sharing that the setup experience and booth received was top tier, and attendees from all over the world sharing love for the event. Some attendees even proclaimed that WordCamp Asia 2023 was the best WordCamp they‚Äôd ever been to!

As WordPress’ flagship WordCamp event for Asia, this event attracts hundreds of WordPress enthusiasts, developers, designers, and business owners from around the globe. By sponsoring WordCamp Asia 2024, your company will gain remarkable exposure, connect with industry leaders, and support the growth of the WordPress community.

We invite you to join us in making this event a resounding success. Partner with us and let’s shape the future of WordPress together!

We invite you to explore the various sponsorship packages we designed to suit your needs.

Sponsorship Packages Details

You will also find the sponsorship application form on our Sponsorship Packages page linked in the button above.

Sponsorship application submission will remain open until November 30th, 2023.

Please feel welcome to contact the sponsors‚Äô team directly by sending an email to asia-sponsors@wordcamp.org

Please note that the sponsorship packages for WordCamp Asia are in high demand and are given out on a first-come, first-served basis.

We look forward to hearing from you!

title.rendered: Important Visa Announcement for WordCamp Asia 2024 Attendees

content.rendered:
We know that traveling abroad and dealing with visa applications can be challenging. When it comes to attending WordCamp Asia 2024 in Taiwan, the visa process can vary for people from different countries. 

We have gathered information on 3 types of visa options for you. 

  1. Visa-Exempt Entry: For 65 countries, Taiwan offers Visa-Exempt Entry, allowing short stays without a prior visa. 
  2. ROC Travel Authorization: If you’re from Cambodia, India, Indonesia, Laos, Myanmar, or Vietnam, you can apply online for an ROC Travel Authorization Certificate. 
  3. Special eVisa: If you’re not eligible for the 2 options mentioned above, we’re working on eVisa assistance for all other countries, offering a 30-day validity.¬†

Please note that, before traveling to Taiwan, ensure that your passport remains valid for at least six months.

Check out detailed visa info

If you still have any visa-related questions, please don‚Äôt hesitate to reach out to our local team at asia-local@wordcamp.org.

title.rendered: Get involved with WordCamp Asia 2024

content.rendered:
After the flagship WordCamp Asia was held in Bangkok in February this year, planning is well underway for our return in 2024‚Äîthis time in the beautiful city of Taipei, Taiwan. 

From March 7-9 2024, over 2000 audiences, volunteers, sponsors and speakers will come together at the Taipei International Convention Center (TICC), one of most visible landmarks in a city that blends rich cultural tradition with a modern landscape. 

WordCamp Asia is a celebration of WordPress, and a celebration of Asia. It‚Äôs an opportunity for people to come together from all corners of the region‚Äîand the world!‚Äîto connect, create and get inspired for the future of WordPress. 

There are a lot of ways that you can get involved‚Äîfrom attending to speaking, sponsoring to volunteering. To help you navigate these opportunities, we‚Äôre breaking down all the different ways you can join us for WordCamp Asia 2024. 

Over the coming weeks, we‚Äôll be posting announcements with more information about each of these ways to get involved with WordCamp Asia 2024. To stay up-to-date, make sure you subscribe to the WordCamp Asia 2024 Newsletter for all the latest news.

Become a Sponsor or Media Partner

Our sponsors and media partners are a vital part of making WordCamps accessible, and the Hallway Track of booths is one of the main attractions of the event.

In 2023, we welcomed over 40 sponsors to the WordCamp Asia family‚Äîan opportunity for these businesses to connect directly with new and existing customers and partners in the region. 

Call for Sponsors is now OPEN!

Become a Speaker

In 2023, we welcomed over 50 speakers to the agenda, from CEO‚Äôs and cofounders to tattoo artists and typography specialists!

Calls for speakers to WordCamp Asia 2024 are now open, and is your opportunity to take to the stage and speak about all things WordPress.  

Apply to become a speaker!

Become a Volunteer

Our volunteer community is what makes WordCamp Asia possible.

In 2023, we had over 80 volunteers in roles including registration, speaker and sponsor support, media and communications, production and venue management. Becoming a volunteer is a great way to not only experience WordCamp Asia, but make new friends in the process. 

Call for Volunteer is now open!

Become an Attendee

Of course, if you just want to soak up everything on offer at WordCamp Asia, then you can buy a ticket and immerse yourself in three days of talks, workshops, and networking events. In 2023, more than 1650 people from over 70 countries joined us at WordCamp Asia in Bangkok, and we‚Äôre going even bigger in 2024.

Coming soon!
